title: (x) swashy wedding script (font #531) - Fine Hand {Nicolai}
content:
Newbie here - I frequently visit the bowfin site when I look for fonts, and have always found what I need - until today, and they are on vacation :(

I need to identify this wedding font, or something very very similar, it is attached below, or can be seen here (font #531)

[http://view.regency.ac/static/AlbumsOnLine/FlowerWeddingAlbum-3F/Options...](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808151231/http:/view.regency.ac/static/AlbumsOnLine/FlowerWeddingAlbum-3F/Options/newfont.asp "http://view.regency.ac/static/AlbumsOnLine/FlowerWeddingAlbum-3F/Options/newfont.asp")

Thanks a bunch for your help, I have looked over the forum and think I’ll enjoy it here!  
Tree Gibs!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [531.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808151231/http:/typophile.com/files/531.jpg) | 16 KB |

 [‹ Looking for font: Guild - abandoned](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808151231/http:/typophile.com/node/19551 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Pitchfork 10th Anniversary New Year's Bash poster - Futura (customised) {Lex} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808151231/http:/typophile.com/node/19605 "Go to next forum topic")
author: gibs2000

comments.content: Dang — I know this one, it’s a classic from the olden Letraset days. But what is its name... Argh!
I think it is called Fine Hand...
Fine Hand doesn’t have that odd B with the descender, as far as I could see from the sample at Myfonts.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/fine-hand/fine-hand/charmap.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808151231/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/fine-hand/fine-hand/charmap.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/fine-hand/fine-hand/charmap.html")

It’s an option. That is a low cap height.  
Tim

Definitely a closed case. It is nice getting some alts in spaces usually occupied by rarely used characters. (Unless of course you were wanting the rarely used characters, I suppose)  
: )
I was really trying to match the uppercase E and the L,and I don’t think the fine hand has the same letters E and L, any other suggestions? Thanks so much for your responses!
Thanks, I was just looking again, and the A is missing the little cap too. Ugh! I’m willing to pay for the font - just need to find it!

They look pretty similar to me.  
Tim

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808151231im_/http:/typophile.com/files/E_L_A_finehands.jpg)
  
{edit: the image won’t upload but those swash characters are available, scroll down the character map to the alternates}
In case you don’t know how to access those, for PC you hold down alt while typing down 4 numbers on the number keypad, which Character Map (system tools) will identify for you.

WOW - thanks so much - I honestly never thought to look at the special characters!!! I have learned something new - I did see the resemblance in the Fine Hand originally but the caps looked so different! Thanks for opening my eyes!!!!

I owe you guys big time!!!!  
T Gibs
